column3: Latest;Poachers were smuggling these Critically Endangered elongated tortoises out of the Cardamom Mountains rainforest. These tortoises were destined to be sold into Vietnam and China’s illegal wildlife trade
column4: where they were most likely to end up on a plate at a restaurant. Fortunately
column5: our Trapeang station rangers apprehended the poachers and confiscated these elongated tortoises
column6: one of 6 Critically Endangered species found in the Cardamom Mountains that our team of more than 140 rangers works to protect 24/7. – WILDLIFE ALLIANCE
